intro: Diplycosia rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while the stems are reddish in color, giving it its common name. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
